alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Calloway; Crittenden; Graves; Livingston; Lyon; Marshall; McCracken; Trigg; Webster (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 12:15PM EST until March 03 at 1:15PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Massac County in southern Illinois... Southeastern Pope County in southern Illinois... Calloway County in western Kentucky... Crittenden County in western Kentucky... Livingston County in western Kentucky... Caldwell County in western Kentucky... Marshall County in western Kentucky... Trigg County in western Kentucky... Southeastern McCracken County in western Kentucky... Southwestern Webster County in northwestern Kentucky... Northeastern Graves County in western Kentucky... Lyon County in western Kentucky... * Until 1215 PM CST. * At 1115 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles north of Brookport to 6 miles west of Benton to near Murray, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Paducah, Murray, Princeton, Benton, Marion, Calvert City, Cadiz, Eddyville, Sturgis, Reidland, Land Between The Lakes Area, Brookport, Salem, Golconda, Olney, Burna, Ledbetter, Creswell, Farmersville and Cobb. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 9 and 69. Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 32 and 37. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 31 and 87. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for southern Illinois...and western, south central and northwestern Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for southern Illinois...and western, south central and northwestern Kentucky.
